name: Golf Scores
author: Tony Korologos

sections.description:
TKServer’s GOLF SCORES for WordPress is a WordPress plugin/widget which tracks a single WP member’s golf scores.  The application is great for tracking 9 or 18 hole golf rounds or frisbee golf rounds.  Golf Scores automatically calculates net scores, shows scoring history, and has a comment area for each round’s commentary.  The plugin includes full administrative back end featuring score entry, score editing and/or moderation.
 
The authorized user may punch in golf scores from the administrative area.
sections.installation:
This section describes how to install the plugin and get it working.

  1. Upload the folder golfScores to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  3. Before use, set preference settings (authorized user, list limits, custom CSS class, etc) in Golf Scores/Wordpress administration
sections.faq:
How many users can track their scores?

One at a time.
sections.changelog:
1.1.0.0

11/06/15
* Updated functionality to WordPress 4.3.1. Fixed some division by zero errors. Cleaned up front end widget paging. Removed some outdated code and features.

1.0.4.1

  • Minor fixes to readme.txt and main file

1.0.4

  • added more user verification to functions for additional security

1.0.3

11/21/13
* added input sanitation for further security

1.0.2

11/21/13
* fixed sql injection threats

1.0.1

11/20/13
* minor tweaks, updated for auto-update

1.0

  • Initial release – 11/16/13

short_description: Golf Scores for WordPress tracks a WP user's golf scores, dates, gross scores, net scores and comments.
